title: Expelled AIADMK leader O Panneerselvam joins DMK in presence of TN CM Stalin
content: Veteran leader O Panneerselvam, a former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister, has officially joined the DMK. This significant political shift follows his expulsion from the AIADMK and comes after failed attempts to unify the party. Sources suggest the DMK may offer him a seat in the upcoming assembly elections, potentially in his former constituency.

title: 'Open war' declared: Pakistan strikes Kabul, Kandahar — 10 things to know about Operation Ghazab Lil Haq
content: Pakistan conducted airstrikes in Afghanistan targeting Taliban military sites. This action followed alleged unprovoked firing from across the border. The operation, named 'Ghazab Lil Haq', reportedly killed 133 Afghans. Afghanistan condemned the strikes, claiming no casualties. Tensions remain high between the two nations over border disputes and recent military actions.

title: Table No 8 and a 'first date': Israel PM Netanyahu recalls India link behind love story with wife Sara
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu revealed a personal connection to India during a joint press conference with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. He shared that one of his first dates with his wife, Sara, took place at an Indian restaurant in Tel Aviv, owned by Reena Pushkarna. “I owe India a great personal debt. When I met Sara (his wife) for the first time, I think our first or second date was in an Indian restaurant in Tel Aviv. It was Reena Pushkarna,” he said.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens below 25,450; Sensex down over 250 points
content: Analysts are of the view that the stock market is likely to move within a narrow range amid mixed global signals, with stock-specific trends expected to dominate trading.

title: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon says AI has displaced workers
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon is urging businesses and governments to prepare for job disruption caused by artificial intelligence. He believes society should not wait for job losses to occur before addressing them. Dimon emphasizes that JPMorgan is embracing AI and has already redeployed employees displaced by the technology.

title: 'Assaulted repeatedly': Class 10 student who delivered baby in exam hall tells MP cops
content: A Class 10 student in Dhar district delivered a baby during her board exam, revealing she was repeatedly sexually assaulted by a known youth. The accused allegedly forced physical relations after she refused his proposal and continued to do so, leading to a concealed pregnancy due to fear and stigma.

title: Rinku Singh’s father passes away after battle with cancer
content: Indian cricketer Rinku Singh's father, Shri Khanchand Singh, passed away after a battle with cancer. Rinku had briefly left the T20 World Cup squad to be with his father during his worsening condition. Despite this personal tragedy, he rejoined the team, though he did not play in the recent match.

title: Uttarakhand horror: 15-year-old forced to drink, gang-raped in car; 2 held
content: Two taxi drivers lured a 15-year-old student away on the pretext of visiting a tourist spot in Haldwani. They allegedly forced her to consume alcohol and raped her in their car at a secluded location. The accused, aged 20 and 24, were arrested after the survivor's family filed a complaint.

title: Cognizant AI chief’s one-word take on Claude-triggered market wipeout
content: Cognizant's chief AI officer dismisses fears of AI disrupting IT services, stating enterprises still need significant support for deployment and integration.  Despite AI advancements, companies require human expertise to map AI agents effectively. This demand is fueling growth for services firms, with rivals like TCS and Wipro echoing similar sentiments, even as some job cuts emerge.

title: Will IIT cross-campus mobility deliver real academic choice?
content: For years, an IIT seat meant four years within one campus. Now, students may take courses and in some cases spend a semester at another IIT, with credits counted back home. The reform promises wider exposure and flexibility, but limited seats, selection rules, logistics and internal hierarchy questions will determine whether this becomes meaningful change or a carefully controlled pilot.

title: 'Papa gaali dete the': Arshdeep reveals how India kept tabs on SA vs WI in Ahmedabad
content: India’s Super Eight fate briefly hinged on the West Indies vs South Africa clash. After South Africa’s win kept their hopes alive, India responded with a clinical performance against Zimbabwe. Backing their “brand of cricket” and team-first approach, the Men in Blue now head into a virtual quarter-final against the West Indies with renewed belief.

title: New GDP data series from today: What are the top changes in the methodology? FAQs answered
content: The new series of data not only revises the base year for calculation purposes to 2022-23, it also incorporates several vital changes with an aim to give a more accurate measurement of the size of the Indian economy and its real and nominal GDP growth.

title: Viral ad shows ‘aged’ Musk, Altman, Bezos backing ‘shocking’ energy source; internet spooked
content: A Belgian AI firm, AiCandy, has created a viral spoof video. It depicts a future where humans exercise to power AI systems. This comes after AI has replaced most jobs. The ad features AI-aged tech leaders. It highlights AI's energy needs and job displacement concerns. The video has sparked significant online discussion.

title: ‘Pelted banners and sticks, threw shoes’: Students detained for breaking JNU gate lock
content: A JNUSU protest against alleged casteist remarks by Vice-Chancellor Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit escalated into a two-hour clash with police after students broke open the locked main gate to march towards the education ministry. Police, who said no permission was granted, detained several students and reported injuries on both sides, as tensions continued on campus into the evening.

title: 'Will pee in your mouth': UP GRP sub-inspector assaults vendor over delay in serving tea, suspended
content: A Government Railway Police sub-inspector in Agra has been suspended after CCTV footage showed him assaulting a tea vendor at Mathura Junction. The officer allegedly slapped the vendor and used abusive language over a delay in serving tea. An inquiry has been initiated following the incident.

title: ‘Must-win games reveal temperament’: Sachin hails India’s 256-run blitz vs Zimbabwe
content: India's T20 World Cup campaign reignited with a dominant 72-run victory over Zimbabwe, setting a new tournament record with their highest-ever total of 256/4. Batting legends praised the team's character and fearless intent under pressure. This emphatic win, fueled by collective batting brilliance, has instilled renewed belief ahead of their next crucial match.

title: Kayla Nicole opens up on life with Travis Kelce
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are just days away from stepping into the most exciting and happy phases of their lives. Amid all the wedding preparations, Travis Kelce's ex girlfriend, Kayla Nicole, has made many controversial digs at the high profile couple. Now, her cryptic confession about Travis Kelce and what it was like dating him has resurfaced and sparked panic.

title: AJ Styles & Wendy Jones combined net worth 2026, retirement and legacy
content: Wrestling icon AJ Styles has officially hung up his boots in February 2026, retiring after a career-ending match and soon after, earning a WWE Hall of Fame induction. He and wife Wendy Jones, married since 2000, are now prioritizing family life in Georgia.

title: Megyn Kelly responds to rumor over Candace Owens’ Bride of Charlie series
content: Megyn Kelly strongly denied rumors that she helped Candace Owens produce the Bride of Charlie series about Erika Kirk. After an X user claimed she screened the series and offered legal advice, Kelly responded, calling the allegation false and the poster a “filthy liar.” She also previously said she has criticized Owens many times and does not comment on every controversy.

title: Columbia student detained by ICE agents to be released after Mamdani–Trump meeting
content: New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani met President Donald Trump at the White House. They discussed major housing investments for the city. The meeting also addressed the arrest of a Columbia University student. The student was later released following intervention. Mamdani presented Trump with a mock newspaper front page. Trump showed enthusiasm for the housing proposal.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for February 27- check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research recommends Colgate-Palmolive (India), and Varun Beverages as the top stocks to buy on February 27, 2026. The brokerage shares a detailed outlook on Nifty and Bank Nifty:

title: Pakistan launches Op Ghazab Lil Haq after 55 killed in Afghan strikes — what we know so far
content: Pakistan has launched Operation Ghazab Lil Haq against the Afghan Taliban after Kabul claimed its forces killed 55 Pakistani soldiers in cross-border strikes. Islamabad disputes the casualty figures, stating only two soldiers died, while claiming 36 Afghan fighters were killed. This escalation follows earlier Pakistani airstrikes targeting militant camps, which Afghanistan alleged killed civilians.

title: Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna's wedding photos leave fans in awe
content: Actors Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna's intimate Udaipur wedding has captivated fans, with photos drawing striking comparisons to mythological epics. A viral image of the couple, their shawl still connected as they hold hands, has sparked comparisons to divine pairings like Shiv-Parvati, Arjuna-Subhadra, and Ram-Sita, highlighting their regal and devoted presence.

title: AI use in warfare: Anthropic rejects US demand for ‘unrestricted’ military access
content: AI firm Anthropic is refusing Pentagon demands for unrestricted use of its technology, citing concerns over mass surveillance and autonomous weapons. This public dispute could cost the company its government contract. While open to negotiation, Anthropic warns the Defense Department's stance offers little progress on preventing misuse. Lawmakers criticize the Pentagon's handling of the situation.

title: Dalit family attacked for playing loud music after namaz in UP; 12 held
content: Twelve individuals were apprehended in Bulandshahr for allegedly assaulting a Dalit family during a naming ceremony. The dispute reportedly erupted over loud music following local prayers. The attackers, armed with sticks, allegedly used casteist slurs and damaged property. Police have registered an FIR and sent the accused to jail, with further arrests anticipated.

title: TISS Guwahati: Spy cam in girls’ hostel bathroom causes furore
content: A hidden camera was discovered in a girls' hostel bathroom at TISS Guwahati. A student found the device concealed in a soap packet. Police have seized the camera for forensic examination. The TISS administration has condemned the incident as a serious privacy violation. An investigation is underway to ensure student safety and prevent future occurrences.

title: 'Our video analyst prepared a slide': Suryakumar Yadav reveals secret behind India's win
content: India kept their T20 World Cup semifinal hopes alive with a dominant 72-run victory over Zimbabwe. A powerful batting display, featuring Abhishek Sharma's 55 and Hardik Pandya's unbeaten 50, set a massive target. Arshdeep Singh's three wickets then stifled Zimbabwe's chase, despite a brilliant 97 from Brian Bennett. This win sets up a crucial decider against the West Indies.

title: Mystery shrouds Bengaluru woman’s murder; stepped out to fetch phone, found strangled hours later
content: A 30-year-old housekeeper, Sonali Khatun, was found murdered near an agricultural field in Bengaluru, with preliminary findings suggesting strangulation. She went out to retrieve her phone from work on Tuesday evening and never returned. Her body was discovered on Wednesday, and police are examining CCTV footage and attempting to trace her missing phone.

title: 'What are we teaching Class VIII children?' PM Modi questions NCERT lapse, Pradhan vows action
content: The Union government is taking swift action following the Supreme Court's strong condemnation of a NCERT textbook chapter referencing judicial corruption. Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan apologized, promising accountability for those responsible. The controversial chapter has been removed, and the book will be rewritten for the 2026-27 academic year, with tighter review processes being considered.

title: Strike-rate problem? Not anymore. India smash Zimbabwe, shatter records
content: India unleashed a record-breaking batting blitz against Zimbabwe, scoring 256/4 with a remarkable 17 sixes. Six batters achieved strike rates over 150, showcasing exceptional collective intent. This dominant performance, marked by minimal dot balls and a powerful finish, reignited India's attacking spirit and kept their semifinal hopes soaring.

title: 'Open war': Pakistan's Khwaja Asif warns as border clashes with Afghanistan resume
content: Pakistan has declared "open war" on the Afghan Taliban government following intense border clashes.  Islamabad launched air strikes on key Afghan cities, including Kabul and Kandahar, after Afghan forces attacked Pakistani troops. The Taliban responded with retaliatory operations, confirming air strikes but denying casualties.  Both sides reported dozens of casualties amidst escalating tensions.

title: This mechanical engineer chose to become a househusband, and why every man should read his story
content: Amit Kumar Dubey, a proud house husband from Bihar, has redefined traditional gender roles by dedicating himself to full-time household management. He gave up his job to support his wife, handling cooking, cleaning, and childcare. Despite occasional worries about his responsibilities as the eldest son, Amit finds fulfillment in his role, supported by his wife and family.

title: Los Angeles Lakers vs Phoenix Suns injury report, stats & player status
content: The Los Angeles Lakers, currently sixth in the standings, face the seventh-place Phoenix Suns in a crucial playoff positioning game. With both teams battling injuries and inconsistent play, the Lakers, led by Luka Doncic and LeBron James, appear to have an edge over a Suns squad missing key scorers like Devin Booker.

title: ED to court: Got sanction to prosecute Chidambaram
content: The Enforcement Directorate has secured clearance from the home ministry to prosecute former finance minister P. Chidambaram in the Aircel-Maxis and INX Media money laundering cases. These proceedings, pending for nearly 15 years due to multiple legal challenges, center on ED’s claims of irregular FIPB approvals and alleged receipt of illicit payments.

title: MLB rumors: Phillies linked to $2.5mn Yankees veteran outfielder
content: Philadelphia Phillies are reportedly eyeing veteran outfielder Randal Grichuk. The move aims to inject a right-handed bat into the outfield lineup. Grichuk, currently on a minor league deal with the New York Yankees, could opt out before Opening Day. This potential acquisition addresses a specific need against left-handed pitching. The Phillies seek to bolster their roster without significant financial commitment.

title: Inside Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda’s wedding album
content: Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda’s wedding photos are finally here, and they do far more than capture a ceremony. The images tell a story — one of friendship, faith, tradition and a love that feels deeply rooted and unfiltered.

title: 'Do it the Auqib Nabi way': Ex-India batter's message to young cricketers goes viral
content: Former India wicketkeeper Dinesh Karthik lauded Jammu and Kashmir pacer Auqib Nabi for his exceptional Ranji Trophy season, calling his performance a benchmark for aspiring cricketers. Karthik highlighted Nabi's consistent dominance, endurance, and resilience, stating he single-handedly propelled his team. Nabi's stellar bowling has been instrumental in Jammu and Kashmir's strong showing in the tournament.

title: IYC protest: Himachal Pradesh-Delhi Police standoff drags on till dawn
content: A dramatic police standoff unfolded between Delhi and Himachal Pradesh forces over the arrest of three Youth Congress workers following a protest. The Delhi-Haryana team faced multiple roadblocks in Shimla, delaying the handover of the accused for 24 hours. A political spat erupted, with the BJP accusing the state government of misusing police power.

title: Knueppel sets rookie 3-pt. record -- in 59 games
content: Kon Knueppel broke Keegan Murray's NBA rookie record for 3-pointers, making his 207th on Thursday night against the Pacers.

title: OSU's Styles wows with 43.5-inch combine vertical
content: Projected top-10 pick Sonny Styles posted the best vertical jump by an off-ball linebacker at the combine since 2003 and also dazzled with a 4.46 time in the 40-yard dash and an 11-foot-2-inch broad jump Thursday.

title: Sources: Trump, college leaders to meet March 6
content: Conference commissioners are expected to join sports celebrities and dignitaries on March 6 in a roundtable discussion with President Donald Trump about the future of college athletics, sources said.

title: Hawks plan Magic City night to honor 'institution'
content: The Hawks are paying tribute to Magic City, Atlanta's famed strip club, with a promotional night planned for March 16.

title: Purdue's Smith joins elite list with 1,000th assist
content: Purdue point guard Braden Smith became the fifth player in Division I history to reach 1,000 assists with his sixth assist against No. 13 Michigan State on Thursday night.

title: Neymar shushes critics after first goals in return
content: Neymar broke his 2026 goal drought in spectacular fashion Thursday, leading Santos to a 2-1 victory over Vasco da Gama in the fourth round of the Brasileirão.

title: NCAA panel proposes targeting ejection changes
content: A Division I football panel is proposing a series of rules changes involving targeting ejections, player dress codes and fair catches, the NCAA announced Thursday.

title: Source: Fins 1st, Steelers worst in NFLPA survey
content: For the third consecutive year, the Dolphins ranked first in the NFL Players Association annual report cards, according to survey results obtained by ESPN. The Steelers finished last.

title: ⌚ Panarin gifts mascot a Rolex for jersey number
content: Panarin wanted to wear the No. 72 upon being traded to Los Angeles. The only problem is the Kings' mascot already wore that number.

content: Out of the WWE loop? Here's everything you need to know ahead of Saturday's Elimination Chamber in Chicago.

content: Top prospects such as David Bailey and Ohio State's linebacker duo starred. Here are our experts on the combine's top workouts.

title: What to expect at NFL combine workouts: Kiper, Miller, Reid and Yates answer 11 questions
content: Which NFL draft prospects should have great combine performances? Who could run the fastest 40-yard dashes, and who will climb boards this week?

title: Men's Power Rankings: Can any team catch Duke?
content: The Blue Devils look like they have the inside track to the top overall seed in the men's NCAA tournament.

title: Latest Bracketology: How two upsets turned the ACC into a nine-bid league
content: Sometimes one big win can elevate a team off the bubble. Clemson and Virginia got those victories Sunday.

title: Wyshynski's NHL trade tier rankings: Which big names could bring a Stanley Cup?
content: The playoff races have restarted, with many teams seeking to bolster their rosters for a deep run this spring.

title: How a mental health focus aided John Tavares' renaissance
content: Through his foundation, the Maple Leafs center has driven awareness of the mental health conversation.

title: Can the Lakers solve their Deandre Ayton dilemma? Why the stakes are high for both sides
content: Deandre Ayton and the Lakers are entering the most crucial stretch of the season. The question is: Will he accept the role they desperately need him to play?

title: Top center fielders: Where J-Rod, Crow-Armstrong, Buxton rank
content: Our list of the elite at every position continues with a spot ruled by some of baseball's young stars.

title: Let's grade NFL signings and trades: Why the Jets are the clear winner in the Johnson-Sweat deal
content: We're handing out report cards on big offseason moves, starting with the Jermaine Johnson-T'Vondre Sweat trade.

title: Max Scherzer's re-signing with Blue Jays fulfills wish from daughter's letter to the club
content: On Wednesday, a source confirmed to ESPN's Alden Gonzalez that Scherzer and the Blue Jays had reached an agreement to keep the 41-year-old three-time Cy Young winner in Toronto.

title: Mexico violence: What happened, FIFA's response and what it means for the World Cup
content: Amid cartel-related violence in Mexico, soccer leagues suspended games. Will the situation affect the country's status as a host for the World Cup?

title: Inside the secret history of the black mamba
content: In late 2002, Nike began creating a global campaign featuring the black mamba -- and presented it to an NBA superstar. That star was not Kobe Bryant.

title: It's been three years since Premier League issued against Man City. What's going on?
content: The Premier League announced it was charging Man City for breaching the rules in February 2023. City have denied the charges, and the hearings ended in December 2024. What is taking so long?

title: Cleveland Heights to honor Olympic gold medalist Laila Edwards
content: Cleveland Heights plans to honor Edwards, the first Black woman to play for the U.S. women's national team.

title: Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao are fighting: Is this 2011?
content: Securing this rematch more than a decade after their first meeting feels like a sequel to a poorly received movie.

title: Women's boxing pound-for-pound rankings: A unanimous choice for No. 1
content: Claressa Shields' continued dominance keeps her firmly atop the list. Here's the latest pound-for-pound rankings.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Randle finishes in top 10, Nembhard in top 50
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players such as Julius Randle, LaMelo Ball and more.

title: Stashing these injured players is a winning move
content: Eric Karabell serves up a list of currently injured players to keep on your radar for the last few rounds of your fantasy drafts.

title: Man killed in wild elephant attack at Aralam farm in Kerala’s Kannur
content: Local residents said presence of wild elephants in the area has intensified again after a brief lull, raising fresh concern over safety in the farm region

title: Kerala Health Minister Veena George discharged from Kannur hospital; further treatment in Thiruvananthapuram
content: Meanwhile, a photograph of the Minister taken with nurses at the Government Medical College Hospital has drawn criticism from political opponents. The selfie reportedly clicked inside the ICU has been questioned over protocol and decorum

title: Cricketer Rinku Singh's father passes away after prolonged illness
content: Rinku's former coach, Masood Amini, told PTI Videos in Aligarh that Khanchand Singh had been battling advanced-stage liver cancer and was in the terminal phase of the illness

title: Supreme Court collegium recommends Justice Sushrut Arvind Dharmadhikari as next Chief Justice of Madras HC
content: Hailing from Madhya Pradesh, Justice Dharmadhikari was born on July 8, 1966 at Raipur and obtained his bachelor’s degree in commerce and law from the Nagpur University

content: Intelligent, tech-based policing is being implemented across major cities in India, bringing both benefits as well as concerns

title: Former Tamil Nadu CM O. Panneerselvam arrives at Anna Arivalayam, to join DMK | LIVE updates
content: O. Panneerselvam will join the DMK in the presence of Chief Minister M.K. Stalin just weeks ahead of the State Assembly elections

title: Two key panels urge Karnataka government to align recruitments with changing economy
content: The Karnataka Policy and Planning Commission and the Karnataka Administrative Reforms Commission have against ‘automatic’ replacement of retiring staff

title: Frozen wages, soaring prices
content: The compounded inflation rate in Karnataka between 2012 and 2024 has been calculated to be at 208.3%. With minumum wage revision hanging fire, workers have a tough time coping wit h the rising cost of living, reports Sharath S. Srivatsa

title: PM orders accountability over NCERT judiciary ‘corruption’ content; Education Minister vows action
content: The Education Ministry writes to the Information and Broadcasting (I&B) Ministry and the Electronics and Information Technology Ministry (MeitY) to stop dissemination of the controversial textbook via digital platforms and media

title: CAG’s Bihar report for 2023 flags revenue arrears to government
content: The audit report noted that the Mines and Geology Department has failed to provide details on these dues for more than five years

title: Mithali Raj inaugurates Riviera 2026 at VIT in Vellore
content: As part of the pro-shows of Riviera 2026, playback singer Sunidhi Chauhan’s performance was part of the inaugural on Thursday

title: NLCIL signs MoU with NPTI for skill development programme
content: According to a press note, the collaboration between NLCIL and NPTI is to provide a job-oriented Diploma Course

title: Marathon held as part of VIT’s fest ‘Riviera 2026’
content: Faculty members and foreign students also participated in the marathon, which covered busy stretches around Katpadi

title: CM Stalin lays foundation for construction of elevated corridor from Thiruvanmiyur to Uthandi
content: The work would be carried out on a hybrid annuity model (HAM) — a mix of engineering, procurement and construction (EPC), and build, operate, transfer (BOT) models

title: Chief Justice of India to visit Tirupati on February 28
content: Ahead of the scheduled visit, a team of officials led by District Collector S. Venkateswar, Joint Collector R. Govinda Rao, trainee Collector Sandeep Raghuvanshi, Superintendent of Police L. Subbarayudu Tirupati Airport Director Bhuminathan and others inspected the site being readied for the ‘Bhumi Puja’.

title: Congress alleges irregularities in land acquisition for Adani coal block in M.P.’s Singrauli, seeks joint panel
content: The demand, raised by Leader of Opposition Umang Singhar, led to intense discussions and arguments between the Treasury and Opposition benches which further led to the Congress MLAs staging a walkout from the House.

title: PM Modi interacts with Indian-origin Jews in Israel, lauds their 'deep-rooted' India connection
content: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) called the community “vibrant” and said, “Their enduring bond with India, traditions carried across generations and remarkable contributions to Israel serve as a living bridge between our countries.”

title: Railway Minister announces portal to attract innovative tech solutions
content: The policy proposes a dedicated innovation portal to enable open submissions of detailed proposals, and provides financial support of up to 50% of the development cost for selected solutions

title: From the ashes, emerges a green idea at Brahmapuram
content: The first Compressed Biogas plant in the State, which converts biodegradable waste into biogas, has become operational at the Brahmapuram garbage treatment yard of the Kochi Corporation. M.P. Praveen meets the engineers and managers of the plant set up by the BPCL Kochi Refinery at the plant site to learn about the facility, which is expected to solve the issue of waste management in the city

title: Stand-off between Delhi and H.P. police forces triggers political row in hill State
content: Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu termed Delhi Police’s action ‘an attempt to undermine the sovereignty of the State’

title: Supreme Court adjourns plea challenging Sonam Wangchuk’s detention under NSA to March 10
content: A Bench of Justices Aravind Kumar and P.B. Varale said it would go through the videos of Wangchuk’s speeches submitted to the court

title: NITI Aayog panel on critical minerals wants joint efforts, policy support for self-reliance
content: Singareni reiterates resolve to actively contribute to the mission through strategic partnerships, innovation

title: ₹397 crore transformer procurement scam: Madras High Court calls for DVAC inquiry report and minutes of tender committee meetings
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan pass the orders on a 2024 writ petition filed by Arappor Iyakkam for registration of a FIR

title: Columbia Student Detained By US Immigration Agents Released After Mamdani Meets Trump
content: Ellie Aghayeva, a senior from Azerbaijan studying neuroscience and politics, hasn't been publicly linked to any of the pro-Palestinian demonstrations that roiled Columbia's campus.

title: 'Pak Will Crush Aggressive Ambitions': Shehbaz Sharif Warns Afghanistan
content: Shehbaz Sharif's statement came hours after Pakistan struck targets inside Afghanistan's major cities overnight.

title: Pak Declares "Open War", Bombs Kabul After Afghan Attack, Claims 133 Killed
content: Islamabad has declared "open war" on the Afghan Taliban government following renewed clashes along the shared border between Afghanistan and Pakistan.

title: 26-Year-Old Nepali Woman Allegedly Gang-Raped In Gurugram, 1 Arrested
content: A Nepali woman returning home by an auto rickshaw in Gurugram was allegedly gang-raped by three people, including the driver of the three-wheeler, officials said on Thursday.

title: 9 Arrested In Rs 1,500-Crore Multi-States Cyber Fraud Case
content: Three persons were arrested in Gujarat's Rajkot district for their alleged involvement in a Rs 1500 crore cyber fraud racket, taking the total number of those held in the case to nine, a police official said on Thursday.

title: UP Man, Who Spent 23 Years In Jail For Wife, Children's Murders, Acquitted By Allahabad High Court
content: The Allahabad High Court has acquitted a man who spent about 23 years in jail after being convicted for the murder of his wife and three children, holding that the prosecution failed to conclusively prove his guilt.

title: Pakistan Afghanistan Clashes LIVE: Pak Launched Op 'Ghazab Lil Haq' After Afghan Forces Kill 55 Troops
content: Pakistan-Afghanistan Tensions LIVE Updates: Pakistan bombed major cities in Afghanistan including the capital Kabul on Friday, with Islamabad's defence minister declaring the neighbours at "open war" following months of tit-for-tat clashes.

title: 'Most Firms Are Late': Jack Dorsey's Block Cuts 4,000 Jobs Amid AI Layoffs
content: Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey said they opted for a single deep round of cuts instead of multiple smaller layoffs over time.

title: Gallium: Chinese Spy Network That Operated In 42 Countries Exposed By Google
content: Google prevented a Chinese-linked hacking group attempting to infiltrate telecom and government organisations across at least 42 countries, the tech giant claimed Wednesday.

title: "Cannot In Good Conscience": Anthropic Rejects Pentagon's Demands
content: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth gave Anthropic until Friday to agree to unconditional military use of its technology or face being forced to comply under emergency federal powers.

title: After NCERT Row, Information Ministry Asked To Stop Circulation Of Book
content: The Union Ministry of Education wrote to the ministries of information and broadcasting, and electronics, asking them to stop the dissemination of a controversial NCERT textbook through digital platforms and electronic media, officials said.

title: Afghanistan Attacks Border Posts, Claims Dozens Killed, Pakistan Hits Back
content: Afghanistan attacked Pakistani forces on Thursday and claimed to have killed and captured dozens of soldiers in retaliation for deadly air strikes days earlier.

title: 'Thankful To Media For Bringing Issue Into Public': Top Court On NCERT Row
content: The Supreme Court on Thursday thanked the media for bringing to the fore the issue concerning NCERT's Class 8 social science book containing "offending" contents on corruption in the judiciary.

title: Police, Students Injured In Clash During JNU Protest March, Several Detained
content: Police and JNU students were injured after they clashed during a march by the students' union here on Thursday, with police claiming that they were assaulted by the protestors.

title: Inside Iran's Missile Power: Why It Alarms West And How Far They Can Reach
content: Iran holds a new round of nuclear talks with the United States on Thursday in Geneva. Its arsenal of missiles has been a sticking point in negotiations.

title: PM Modi Israel Visit Highlights: 'Confident Ties Will Reach New Heights': PM Modi As He Leaves Israel
content: Narendra Modi Israel Visit Highlights: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is travelling to Israel on a two-day high-profile visit on Wednesday, marking his second trip to Tel Aviv after the historic 2017 visit.

title: India-Israel Ties Elevated To "Special Strategic Partnership" During PM's Visit
content: India and Israel on Thursday announced the elevation of their bilateral relationship to a "Special Strategic Partnership for Peace, Innovation and Prosperity", marking a significant expansion of cooperation across defence, technology and trade.

title: Instagram To Alert Parents When Teens Search For Suicide Terms
content: Instagram will begin notifying parents when their teenage children repeatedly search for content related to suicide or self-harm, platform owner Meta announced Thursday, as the company faces mounting legal pressure over its handling of young users.

title: White House Accused Of Hiding Trump Allegations In Epstein Files
content: The top Democrat on a congressional committee probing the Jeffrey Epstein scandal accused the White House Thursday of covering up revelations about President Donald Trump in files on the late sex offender.

title: Tigers Changing Stripes, Preying More Actively On Humans: Study
content: The growing number of tigers and humans has enhanced the man-animal conflict, leading to more instances of tiger attack.

title: DMK trying to confuse the minorities about alliance, says Edappadi K. Palaniswami
content: AIADMK stands for all religions; ‘think about the welfare programmes implemented by AIADMK for your benefit,’  the AIADMK general secretary says in an appeal to the minorities

title: Family courts can’t be liberal in giving adjournments only because litigant is a woman: Karnataka High Court
content: The High Court imposed cost on a woman for intentionally dragging the matter and wasting time of courts

title: Activists flag concern over Karnataka’s proposed Right to Health Bill
content: Questions raised over whether the Bill meaningfully advances the right to health or dilutes the State’s responsibility as the primary provider of care

title: ECI reviews  preparedness for the coming Assembly election in Tamil Nadu
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar, along with Election Commissioners Sukhbir Singh Sandhu and Vivek Joshi, interacted with representatives of the recognised national and State political parties and sought their suggestions

title: Develop protocol for filling vacancies in open correctional institutions, Supreme Court tells States
content: Bench says prisons are institutions of correction, where dignity, self-respect and social reintegration are not aspirational ideals but constitutional necessities

title: Sunetra Pawar unanimously elected as NCP national president
content: Praful Patel re-elected as national working president, Sunil Tatkare as State chief; Ajit Pawar’s son Parth to become Rajya Sabha MP

title: Watch | Maharashtra–Karnataka border row back in focus: Why is it still unresolved?
content: The decades-old Maharashtra–Karnataka border dispute was once again raised in the Maharashtra Assembly, with Governor Acharya Devvrat reiterating the government’s commitment to resolve the issue.

title: NCERT textbook ‘rewrite’ was an ‘RSS-driven exercise’: Congress
content: The way NCERT textbooks have been rewritten over the past decade is disgraceful; apart from being dangerous, says the Congress spokesperson

title: Chief of panel probing Manipur violence quits, ex-Supreme Court judge to take over
content: Since its formation on June 4, 2023, the commission was given four extensions, the latest on December 16 last year; it has received around 11,000 affidavits

title: Vizag to roll out AI driven traffic management systems
content: Vizagites could see artificial intelligence-driven surveillance with over 2,000 high-end cameras visible at 56 corridors (like RK Beach Road) across 102 junctions in the city under this Rs 60-65 crore worth project.

title: Karnataka High Court allows mother’s plea to change minor daughter’s surname to reflect maternal lineage in birth certificate
content: The presumption that a child must invariably bear the surname of the father is not a constitutional mandate but a social convention, the court said

title: Supreme Court asks CBI, probe agencies to share charge sheet copies with Manipur violence victims, families
content: A three-judge Bench headed by CJI Surya Kant issued the directions after going through the 12th status report submitted by former Maharashtra DGP Dattatray Padsalgikar

title: ED places before court prosecution sanction orders against P. Chidambaram in two cases
content: The agency aims to expedite the trial, alleging that those linked to Karti P. Chidambaram received illegal gratification for approving FIPB for INX Media and FDI for the Aircel-Maxis deal while P. Chidambaram was Finance Minister

title: Global order in peril from lack of cooperation, says Merkel; slams China, U.S. for resisting AI regulation
content: Former German Chancellor delivers first Manmohan Singh lecture, praises former PM for economic reforms; says governments must hold big tech firms, social media platforms, AI developers to account

title: Revisiting the timeless allure of classic cars at Udaipur’s Oberoi Concours d’Elegance 2026
content: The second edition of the Oberoi Concours d’Elegance in Udaipur saw 120 classic cars and bikes, celebrating automotive heritage. What came through at the event besides culture, currency, and caviar, was the emotion associated with the vehicles

title: Why bulldozers threaten due process
content: The Allahabad High Court examines whether demolitions carried out immediately after FIRs violate constitutional principles, stressing that punishment lies exclusively with the judiciary; it warns that such selective demolitions, carried out without notice or hearing, undermine due process, erode constitutional rights

title: Aravalli row: Supreme Court asks Environment Ministry, others to suggest names of domain experts for panel
content: The panel will define the Aravalli hills and ranges. The court observes that only lawful mining would be allowed in the region and extends the stay order on the uniform definition of these hills

title: CJI vows reforms in working of Supreme Court Registry
content: Decision comes after Chief Justice found that similar cases are being listed for hearing before different Benches of the top court

title: Fitness of old private buildings remains unchecked in Kozhikode
content: Though structural safety audits of old public buildings happen at regular intervals under the supervision of qualified engineers, such an inspection is hardly conducted to check the condition of many old facilities in the private sector

title: BJD seeks Odisha Minister’s resignation after farmer dies while waiting at procurement centre
content: While the BJP Government had promised to procure all the paddy, only about 63 lakh metric tonnes, approximately 33% of the total production, have been procured in Odisha so far

title: Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyay’s descendant joins BJP ahead of Bengal poll
content: In September 2025, Sumitra Chattopadhyay and her relative Sajal Chattopadhyay joined Bengal BJP president Samik Bhattacharya to address the neglect of the ancestral home of Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyay

title: CM orders strict water safety monitoring across urban local bodies
content: Municipal Administration and Urban Development Department, Public Health Engineering, Health Department and district administrations have been instructed to work in close coordination and intensify field inspections

title: North Paravur municipality plans heritage township project
content: This was announced in the annual Budget presented by municipal vice-chairperson Laiji Biju. The Budget envisages a revenue of ₹60,0316,471 and an expenditure of ₹56,1281,040

title: Scrap EAPCET, English medium from Class 1 and no automatic promotions to teachers; Education Commission recommends
content: The Commission submitted its report to Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy on Thursday, proposing that the education policy be made entirely student-centric

title: Pinarayi Vijayan sheds light on little-known aspects of his life in a free-wheeling interview with actor Mohanlal
content: The Chief Minister reveals his love for Rajanikanth movies and his preference for action flicks. He also dwells on how reading had helped him shrug off his childhood fear of “ghosts and demons”

title: T.K. Oommen, a leading architect of modern Indian sociology, passes away
content: A highly-respected scholar, teacher and author, Prof. Oommen is known for his writings and approaches to social justice, identity and pluralism; he had gained wide attention for his study of the Bhoodan Movement

title: GBA chief’s public meeting draws huge crowd; citizens welcome the initiative
content: Residents have raised concerns over issues, including fallen leaves on pedestrian pathways, illegal dumping of waste, building violations, haphazard parking and footpath encroachments

title: NCERT textbook content shows ‘deep-rooted conspiracy’ to show judiciary as corrupt: Supreme Court
content: Declaring that “heads must roll”, CJI Surya Kant orders “blanket and complete ban” on the Class 8 social science textbook; initiates contempt action, issues show cause to NCERT director, School Education Secretary

title: Close down Panka mosque, say leaders during Bagalkot Chalo
content: They say that the mosque has been a point of contention for several decades and it has led to several law and order disturbances

title: Two Maoists killed in Bijapur encounter
content: The slain Maoists have been preliminarily identified as Hichami Madda and Manki Podium and they were carrying a reward of ₹5 lakh each, say police

title: Samyukt Kisan Morcha to meet CMs, Opposition leaders against U.S. deal in fight for federal rights
content: SKM leaders say they will submit a memorandum to the Chief Ministers and Leaders of Opposition for protecting interest of farmers by holding special sessions of State Assemblies and adopting resolutions asking the Union government to refrain from signing the deal

title:
A.P. Assembly approves amendments 
to Assigned Lands, GSWS Bills
content: Decks cleared for the government to acquire assigned lands on long-term lease to set up renewable energy projects under A.P. Integrated Clean Energy Policy 2024

title: Bangladesh tension leads to 9% fall in foreign tourist arrivals
content: latest official data estimated tourist arrivals from Bangladesh at 4.7 lakh in 2025, 73% lower than the level in the previous year . 12.8 lakh decline was more than the 9.3 lakh fall in the overall foreign tourists arrivals . number of Indians going abroad rose 6.6% to a record 3.3 crore . there was a dip in the number of foreign tourists going abroad .

title: SC bans NCERT book over ‘judicial corruption’ chapter; govt apologises in top court
content: the class 8 social science textbook had a section on corruption in judiciary . it was banned from circulation in all forms . govt has apologised for "the unpardonable mistake" committed by two people who authored the book .

title: 45% drop in Indians at US universities over visa uncertainty, high cost
content: Manash Pratim Gohain is a seasoned journalist with over two decades at The Times of India, where he has built a rich body of work spanning education policy, politics, and governance. Renowned for his incisive coverage of the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, accreditation reforms, and skilling initiatives, he has also reported on student politics, urban policy, and social movements. His political reportage—both reflective and news-driven—adds depth to his writing, bridging policy with public impact. Through his 2,500 articles and related outlets, he has emerged as a trusted voice in national discourse, particularly in linking education reform to broader societal change. Read More

title: Trump tariff in limbo, US commerce secretary meets Piyush Goyal

title: 'Science knows no country...': Quote of the day by Louis Pasteur
content: The TOI Science Desk stands as an inquisitive team of journalists, ceaselessly delving into the realms of discovery to curate a captivating collection of news, features, and articles from the vast and ever-evolving world of science for the readers of The Times of India. Consider us your scientific companion, delivering a daily dose of wonder and enlightenment. Whether it's the intricacies of genetic engineering, the marvels of space exploration, or the latest in artificial intelligence, the TOI Science Desk ensures you stay connected to the pulse of the scientific world. At the TOI Science Desk, we are not just reporters; we are storytellers of scientific narratives. We are committed to demystifying the intricacies of science, making it accessible and engaging for readers of all backgrounds. Join us as we craft knowledge with precision and passion, bringing you on a journey where the mysteries of the universe unfold with every word. Read More

title: T.N. increases guest lecturers’ pay by ₹5,000 a month
content: the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in! the monthly honorarium has been raised by 5,000 for guest lecturers in government arts and science colleges, ad . the monthly honourarium is being raised by the Tamil Nadu government .

title: Matt Holliday's Stillwater estate listed for $12 million
content: a Stillwater, Oklahoma, home that once belonged to an MLB champion and seven-time All-Star is on the market at $12 million . the home features sports-related amenities such as a professionally lit baseball field in the front yard, a putting green in the backyard, and a $2 million, two-level swimming pool . indoor batting cages, pickleball and basketball courts reside in a detached $150,000 guest home on the property .

title: NFLPA 2026 report cards: See the results for all 32 teams
content: ESPN obtained the results of the NFL Players Association's 2026 report cards . it grades franchises from A-plus to F-minus on everything from ownership to treatment of families . all players who were on a 2025 roster at the time of the survey were eligible to participate .

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea confident of landing Aston Villa's Rogers
content: Chelsea remain keen on aston villa midfielder Morgan Rogers . real madrid have their eye on arsenal's Gabriel Magalhes, according to teamTalk . the 23-year-old will likely have to be over the £100 million villa received from Manchester City in 2021 .

title: Prospects to watch: From the high school son of a former MLB All-Star to the next Mets ace﻿
content: the 2026 World Baseball Classic offers a unique opportunity to get a glimpse at some of baseball's stars of tomorrow . one of the most intriguing is Joseph Contreras, a prep right-hander in Georgia and the son of former big league righty . he is best known for his time with the New York Yankees and Chicago White Sox .

title: Champions League talking points: Madrid, PSG or Italian football -- who is worse off?
content: seventeen goals and three red cards in four games capped chaotic night . a 5-2 aggregate win over internazionale and 5-2 win over england . manchester united and chelsea both made light work of club brugge and FK Qarabag .

title: The game that will define the 2026 season for every power-conference team
content: the season-defining game will be for all 68 power-conference teams in 2026 . peruse BC's schedule given last year's struggles, and it's tough to find many wins . the Eagles open on the road at Cincinnati, then play FCS Maine .

title: Way-too-early roster predictions for the 2026 MLB All-Star Game
content: it's time for our annual way-too-early All-Star selections . we predict who will make the trip to Philadelphia for the 2026 Midsummer Classic in 138 days . 34 players have hit at least 50 home runs in a season, with 23 doing it just once .

title: Power Rankings: Stakes are high for UCLA, two teams rejoin the list
content: the Bruins will be just the fourth program to finish with a perfect regular season in the Big Ten women's college basketball . the last to do it was Maryland in 2015, the season the Terps joined the big Ten and advanced to the final Four for the second year in a row .
